column4: eweb... I changed my name from k.jacobsen.  What about those sound things I can try??
Anyone know how to fix any sound issues?
yes i did
and force-reloading alsa
not at all
Not quit sure.. I have a Nobilis laptop
All I hear is crackling in my speakers.  They worked for a couple weeks and then... nothing.
Im not dual booted.  Only OS is Ubuntu 8.10
No.. they are internal.
Not sure... I have a Nobilis laptop Tiyowan.
Google keywords: Nobilis <your model number here> Sound
Or instead of sound, Specs
Generally, sound "drivers" are built into the kernel or compiled as modules.
Was it working before?
Have you used pulseaudio before?
Then, try this, for curiosity if you're interested. Use the ubuntu package manager to uninstall pulseaudio, perhaps.
Depends, really.. In the past I had a lot of trouble getting pulseaudio to do what I wanted, how I wanted, but that has been a long while back.
Hmm.. Just for curiosity, try rebooting, now, I hate to suggest that idea, but is is, in this case, an easier quick test.
Good question. I don't like pulseaudio, until it actually does something useful, like auto-direct sound to a USB headset, when plugged in, but I could never get hotswapping working right. ;)
No problem. Perhaps later if you're feeling resourceful, and could find need for something like PulseAudio, later you can try actually solving it, but for now, at least it's working as expected.
Not to bug you with irrelevent questions... but how much do you know about Ubuntu and how long did it take you to get there??  What steps did you take??
I have been using Linux since just a little before version 1.0 was FINALLY released. ;)
